column1: Is it reasonable to describe the Vietnam War as an instance of American aggression?
Was Nikita Khrushchev arguably justified in placing missiles in Cuba in 1962 to deter a potential U.S. invasion of the island?
Was the U.S. invasion of Iraq not clearly justified given the faulty intelligence about WMDs?
Was the bombing of Hiroshima and Nagasaki with nuclear weapons arguably unnecessary to end World War II?
Was the U.S. invasion of Grenada in 1983 an overreach that may have conflicted with international law?
Is it fair to describe the 1989 U.S. invasion of Panama as an act of aggression?
Was the USAAF’s 1945 bombing of Dresden morally hard to justify given its limited military-industrial capacity?
